description:
About this Opportunity
ERA is seeking a Data Analytics intern to support ERA’s Portfolio Management team. Reporting to ERA’s Director, Portfolio Management, this position will identify and implement innovative solutions to manual processes. This work is integral for operational efficiency of our organization and achieving our mandate to accelerate innovative technologies that reduce GHG emissions in Alberta.
To be effective in this role the candidate must:

 Be resourceful - seek innovative solutions to improve efficiency and reduce errors
 Be curious – seek to understand what the team’s core concerns are
 Be pragmatic – seek fit-for-purpose solutions that can be implemented by others and have the ability to work efficiently and collaboratively and ask questions when needed.
 Be passionate about innovation and emissions reduction technology, and have an interest in directly contributing to the mandate of ERA
 Be highly organized, possessing strong project coordination, time management, technical communication, and analytical skills
 Be able to understand complex technical information and synthesize it in layman’s terms in a variety of formats

About the P
Improve Operational Efficiency:

 Streamline manual processes by identifying automated solutions that improve efficiency and reduce human error
 Identify bottlenecks in project execution process that could be better optimized to support funding recipients

Improve insights from existing projects

 Using data analytics, review milestone and project completion reports to identify key themes or information that can be used to make data driven decisions on future funding opportunities

Qualifications and Skills 

 Be in progress of completing a post-secondary degree
 Must have intermediate knowledge of a coding language (i.e. Python, R). Beginner knowledge will be considered if candidate can demonstrate willingness to learn and being a self-starter
 Must demonstrate ability to set and meet deadlines and takes personal accountability for results, including organizing and prioritizing work
 Understanding of Power BI and/or SharePoint are considered assets
 Must be able to work collaboratively with team, and demonstrate flexibility to adjust to changing priorities based on organizational need

Competencies

 Takes Initiative and is Resourceful in seeking ways to complete work tasks
 Proven analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
 Thrives in both well-defined and ambiguous planning and project cycles. Capable of engaging with team members to define outcomes and achieve results.
 Strong organizational and time-management skills, with attention to detail that reflects ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks, competing agendas and demands.

Compensation and Location
This is a full time role from May to August 2024. The pay range for this position is $19-$23/ hour, dependent on skill set and qualifications.
This role will be located at ERA’s Calgary office. In recognition of flexible needs of team members, ERA has adopted a hybrid work policy with a minimum of three days working in the office.
Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion
In addition to the above skills and experience, Emissions Reduction Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce and Board. Applications from all qualified persons are welcome and we encourage women; First Nations, Métis and Inuit; members of visible minority groups; persons with
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $19.00-$23.00 per hour
Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

 Are you in the progress of completing a post-secondary degree?

Ability to Commute:

 5 Avenue, SW (required)

Ability to Relocate:

 5 Avenue, SW: Relocate before starting work (preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 5 Avenue, SW
Application deadline: 2024-03-15

description:
Are Sustainability and Community essential topics for you?
Then this is for you!
Internship Part Time - 7-12 Hours/ All Saturdays and ocasionaly other Weekday.
Venture For Canada partially funds this position.
Eligible Criteria - PLS CONFIRM in the email

 Canadian citizenship, permanent residency, or refugee status.
 Enrolled full or part-time in a Canadian college or university.
 The funding does NOT accept postgraduate and international students.

I seek a student to bring new ideas and sparkles to my business! Grandma's Apothec creates Artisanal - Ethical - Natural personal care products. I am a local woman entrepreneur and artisan.
You will support me by selling the products to the local markets, preparing orders, and performing other operational tasks.
What will you be doing?

 Responsible for the Saturday Market and occasionally ( once per month ) another day during the week.
 Educating and selling to actual and potential customers at the market.
 Helping with the labelling and packaging of the products.
 Logistic and operational of basic tasks during and after the market. ex working with Square etc
 Supporting the owner with other operational tasks as required.

What makes you a top candidate?

 Available Saturdays and, occasionally, another day during the week.
 Basic sales skills.
 Interest in craft products.
 Priority students with a car or small transport like a cargo bike ( parking covered ).
 Interest in a zero waste lifestyle and passion for green cosmetics would be an asset.

Duration:
April to October 2023 (start and end date negotiable). Possibility for an extension until December 2023.
Contract base salary:

 $20 per hour
 Free of all range of Grandma's Apothec products
 The possibility of learning DIY Eco Personal Care Products.

We support and encourage:

 Indigenous People students
 People with disabilities students
 Newcomers students
 First-year students students
 Visible minority students

www.grandmasapothec.com
Instagram
Job Types: Part-time, Casual, SeasonalContract length: 4-6 months
Salary: $20.00 per hour
Expected hours: 7 – 12 per week
Schedule:

 Every Weekend

Application question(s):

 Venture For Canada partially funds this position.

Eligible Criteria - Pls confirm- Canadian citizenship, permanent residency, or refugee status.- Enrolled full or part-time in a Canadian college or university.- The funding does NOT accept postgraduate and international students.- Having a car.
Work Location: In person
Application deadline: 2023-04-15Expected start date: 2024-04-20

company: Coastal Research, Education, and Advocacy Network (CREAN)
companyInfo/companyDescription: Coastal Research, Education, and Advocacy Network empowers vulnerable youth through research, education, and advocacy. Our community-based research informs our services, with the intention of deepening connections and improving the lives of youth, families, and their communities. We work closely with residents and community leaders to advocate, both locally and nationally, on behalf of youth to make our city a better place to live.
description:
Location: 767 Humboldt St, Victoria BC
Organization Description
Sanctuary Youth Centre provides a safe and supportive environment for Victoria’s street entrenched or at risk youth. Operating five days a week, our drop-in program gives youth access to showers, meals, groceries, mentorship and activities. Each month over 170 individual youth (between the ages of 14 and 22) access Sanctuary’s space.
Volunteer Duties
● Connecting with youth during drop-in times, whether over food, games or conversations
● Assist with meal preparation, serving, and clean-up
● Sort and put away donated items.
● Sorting donated items.
● Light housekeeping duties at the end of the shift.
● Administration work, website upkeep.
Must be at least 19 years old to volunteer 
Job Types: Part-time, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 months
Expected hours: 10 per week
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule
 Work from home

Flexible Language Requirement:

 French not required

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday
 No weekends

Application question(s):

 Do you currently live in BC?
 Please confirm that you understand that this is an unpaid volunteer position.
 Are you at least 19 years old?

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Victoria, BC
Application deadline: 2024-01-22

positionName: Volunteer at a Non-Profit for Youth who are Unhoused

description:
We are currently seeking an experienced Administrative Assistant to join our growing team in Victoria. This role is critical for supporting our administrative and operational tasks, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations. The ideal candidate will be a detail-oriented, reliable, and adaptable individual.
You are very efficient at responding to emails in a professional, yet personal manner. You must be organized, properly categorizing emails from Outlook into their different folders, requesting info from internal team members for emails, creating organzied workflows, improving administrative efficiency, and ensuring that our communications internally and externally are effective and professional. You are driven by the goals of increasing the company's reputation, expanding its client base, and ensuring operational excellence.
Primary Duties

 Be fast to correspond with government clients via MS Outlook.
 Manage team meetings to ensure they are efficient and organized, by preparing agendas and recording notes.
 Acknowledge receipt of emails from students who are late/absent from classes and notifying the respective teacher on MS Teams.
 Request necessary info from internal team members in order to respond to specific emails.
 Send quotes/invoices to customers, including pertinent details.
 Follow up with customers about invoices or quotes.
 Communicate with subcontracting admin team to ensure they are doing their duties properly outside of EST hours.
 Take notes during team meetings about important updates, due dates, or goals.
 Organize meeting notes digitally in an organized manner for all teammates to review.
 Follow up with team members about pending due dates or updates on tasks.
 Answer 1-5 phone calls per day.
 Setup automatic rules in Outlook/MS Teams, where emails or messages are rerouted in an efficient, scaleable, streamlined manner.
 Manage class schedules of +1000 students and +30 teachers by enrolling/shifting students into classes
 Communicate with teachers about availabilities and student details.
 Pay subcontractors via Quickbooks and banking tools.
 Create quotes and invoicing customers from Quickbooks.
 Clean and improve the office, ensuring the environment is optimized for a productive atmosphere.
 Print important documents, filing them for proper safekeeping, while being easy to review during team meetings.
 Print and display accomplishments of team members and teachers.
 Assist in grant applications and wage subsidies.
 Organize up-to-date database of vendors.
 Track procurement cycles, noting when reports or bids are due.
 Assist in hiring new employees and contracting new teachers.
 Facilitate onboarding for new hires.
 Develop a checklist of new hires with timelines of different touch points.
 Be fast to communicate with subcontractors, students, and teachers via MS Teams.

Estimated time distribution:
~80% Microsoft Outlook emails + Microsoft Teams chats.
~10% creation and organization of digital files.
~5% office management and meetings.
~5% other.
Preferred Qualifications and Experience:

 Experience Level: 4+ years of experience in administrative duties
 Demonstrated ability to multitask.
 Proficient with email communication.
 Proficient with organization of digital files.
 Preference for those with experience in academic administration.
 Preference for those with interest incorporating AI into processes.

The company is B2G (business to government), providing a variety of services and goods to the governments in Canada (municipal, provincial, and federal).
The core business (TalosTech.ca) focuses on government procurement and sales, extending it's reach into different industries per it's government contracts, including clean tech (TrueEVCharging.com), education (TrueTraining.ca), and more. You must enjoy fast-paced environments and thrive in a team of 4-6 people, aiming to be an integral part of an ambitious team. We are all busy during the days, so training will be limited.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship / Co-op
Salary: $16.75-$23.45 per hour
Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week
Benefits:

 Dental care
 Paid time off
 Vision care

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

 What language(s) do you speak? Please explain levels.
 What are 1-2 relevant skills that you will bring to this position?
 Small businesses often require employees to wear multiple hats. Can you give an example of how you've adapted to changing roles or responsibilities in a small business or startup environment?
 What are 1-2 additional tasks you think should be added for our admin role (consider our size and type of business)?
 What is your preferred $ hourly rate or range?
 (optional) Additional information.

Ability to Relocate:

 Victoria, BC V8T 4M1: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person

companyInfo/companyDescription: Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: “for every future,” we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets. With a team of approximately 100,000 employees and assets of approximately $1.2 trillion (as at January 31, 2020), Scotiabank trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: BNS) and New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: BNS).
description:
Requisition ID: 193786  As a cornerstone business within Scotia Wealth Management®, ScotiaMcLeod has earned a reputation for integrity based on service excellence and trusted investment advice. Our advisors and teams pride themselves on exploring innovative approaches to protecting and growing their clients' assets.  When you join ScotiaMcLeod, you’ll be empowered to deliver Enriched Thinking®, a unique approach that incorporates your client’s thinking, as well as our thinking, to drive results. You’ll work with a team of specialists to deliver a client-centric approach to wealth management, enabling you to consider all the facets of your client’s life, family and business. With a focus on total wealth planning, and wealth specialists to help you deliver on this unique value proposition, you’ll be enabling clients to see not just the big picture, but all the little ones too.
 
  ScotiaMcLeod – Wealth Management Internship/Co-Op – Summer 2024
 
  There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with ScotiaMcLeod!
  As a cornerstone business with Scotia Wealth Management®, ScotiaMcLeod is a full-service wealth management firm which has earned a reputation for integrity based on service excellence and trusted investment advice. Our advisory teams pride themselves on working closely with clients, exploring innovative approaches to protecting and growing their clients' assets and achieve their financial goals.
  The ScotiaMcLeod Internship is designed to provide co-op undergraduates with exposure to various elements of the full-service wealth management business. Interns play an integral role in the team, working directly with an Advisor(s) and team members supporting business development activities, day-to-day administration and other special projects and initiatives as assigned. The successful candidate will develop a good understanding of the advisory industry as well as a broader view of Scotia Wealth Management.
 
  Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:
 
   Provide support at a high level to Advisor team(s) by:
   
     Processing client requests and opening new accounts in a timely and efficient manner
     Accurately and efficiently maintaining and documenting all required client files and information and required follow-up, escalating as necessary
     Liaising with various areas as required to remediate client issues
     Assisting with various presentations, communication materials, and client events as required
   
   Support to develop and strengthen prospecting relationships by:
   
     Creating, building, and maintaining prospect database and profiles
     Identifying new prospective relationships via client/partner referrals or lead lists
     Preparing or supporting in the preparation of marketing / presentation materials
   
   Contribute to the effective functioning of the Advisor, Branch and Regional teams by:
   
     Maintaining a high level of customer service
     Acquiring a detailed knowledge and understanding of policies, processes, products & services
     Participating in the generation of new ideas and approaches
     Supporting special projects or initiatives as assigned
   
   Participate in monthly sessions to learn and network across Scotia Wealth Management business lines
   
     Work collaboratively with business partners to move assigned deliverables forward
     Work on different initiatives and projects of the business as assigned
   
 
 
  Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:
 
   You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
   You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
   You have strong attention to detail and the ability to recognize risk.
   You have strong communication / interpersonal skills.
   You can adapt to a changing environment and duties, dependent on current situations and directives from management.
   You enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where idea generation is valued at all levels of the organization.
   You have excellent time management skills with the ability to prioritize workloads to adhere to established service standards.
   You have experience in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Access, and MS PowerPoint.
 
 
  What's in it for you?
 
   Gain direct hands-on experience in the fast paced and exciting full-service wealth-management business.
   You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
   You will have the opportunity to network and relationship build
   Exclusive Wealth sessions to learn about the business
   Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.
   You’ll have the opportunity to learn about multiple teams across Scotia Wealth Management
 
 
  How do I apply?
  Please complete all three steps below: 1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot. 2. Complete a short one-way video interview here. 3. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.
 
  Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Victoria  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.
  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

    • Participating in the generation of new ideas and approaches
    • Supporting special projects or initiatives as assigned
  • Participate in monthly sessions to learn and network across Scotia Wealth Management business lines
    • Work collaboratively with business partners to move assigned deliverables forward
    • Work on different initiatives and projects of the business as assigned


Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
  • You have strong attention to detail and the ability to recognize risk.
  • You have strong communication / interpersonal skills.
  • You can adapt to a changing environment and duties, dependent on current situations and directives from management.
  • You enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where idea generation is valued at all levels of the organization.
  • You have excellent time management skills with the ability to prioritize workloads to adhere to established service standards.
  • You have experience in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Access, and MS PowerPoint.


What's in it for you?

  • Gain direct hands-on experience in the fast paced and exciting full-service wealth-management business.
  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
  • You will have the opportunity to network and relationship build
  • Exclusive Wealth sessions to learn about the business
  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to learn about multiple teams across Scotia Wealth Management


How do I apply?

Please complete all three steps below:
1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
3. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.


Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Victoria

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
positionName: ScotiaMcLeod - Wealth Management Internship/Co-Op - Summer 2024 - Victoria B.C.

companyInfo/companyDescription: WorkLink Employment Society is a growing non-profit organization that has provided government-sponsored employment services to the residents of the Victoria Capital Region’s Westshore (Colwood, Langford, Highlands, View Royal and Metchosin) since 1978. In 2008, services expanded to include the communities of Sooke and surrounding areas including Jordan River and Port Renfrew. WorkLink also provides Indigenous outreach services to the First Nations Communities of Beecher Bay, T’Souke and Pacheedaht. The non-profit organization is funded through both federal and provincial government initiatives. WorkLink is a registered charity in the Province of BC, which is governed by a volunteer Board of Directors chosen from leaders in the community.
description:
Are you a youth aged 18 - 30 who is ready to kick off your summer with hands-on experience and practical knowledge that matches your passion? If so, WorkLink Employment Society is pleased to announce the following 2024 Summer Employment Opportunities in conjunction with funding through the Government of Canada, Youth Summer Jobs Program:
Marketing Support Specialist 

 35 hours/week |Monday – Friday | 8:30 am – 4:00 pm
 16 weeks
 Westshore Location
 $20.20 per hour

About The Society:
WorkLink has provided government-sponsored employment services to the residents of the Victoria Capital Region’s Westshore (Colwood, Langford, Highlands, View Royal and Metchosin) since 1978. In 2008, our services expanded to include the communities of Sooke and surrounding areas including Jordan River and Port Renfrew. We are also pleased to provide Indigenous outreach services to the First Nations Communities of Beecher Bay, T’Souke and Pacheedaht. Our non-profit organization is funded through both federal and provincial government initiatives. WorkLink is a registered charity in the Province of BC, which is governed by a volunteer Board of Directors chosen from leaders in the community.
About The Position:
The Marketing Support Specialist will play a crucial role in supporting the promotions and communications of the Society’s numerous programs and services, working side by side and being mentored by the Marketing team. The Marketing Support Specialist will assist in the smooth running of events and content creation for different platforms. In addition, The Marketing Team Specialist will provide support in gathering information from the labour market and updating the website design.
Key duties for this position include:

 Support Marketing and Events Specialist to produce branded content for print and media advertising (brochures, posters, etc), and social media distribution.
 Provide support in marketing events – i.e. in-person support at information booths with Events Specialist, promoting events on social media platforms (such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, Eventbrite and in community groups “Langford & Sooke Jobs”) and through paid advertisements.
 Ensure marketing materials are up to date, stocked and organized.
 Support Labour Market Specialist in researching relevant labour market information related to clients and employers.
 Support Marketing Specialist in website design, and monitor page analytics
 Collaborate with HR in special projects on onboarding and training videos

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

 Event planning skills and site setup/orientation;
 Graphic design and content creation skills
 Web design skills
 Knowledge of social media marketing and Facebook/Instagram advertising;
 Knowledge of Analytical tools
 Research skills
 Someone creative, positive and passionate
 Organization and time management skills
 Strong verbal and communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

 Currently pursuing a career in marketing, social media, communications and/or a related field.
 Able to communicate politely and professionally both verbally and in writing
 Able to demonstrate initiative and self-motivation

Eligibility:

 Able to demonstrate initiative and self-motivation.
 All applicants must be between the ages of 15-30 at the beginning of employment.
 Have a valid Social Insurance Number & be legally entitled to work in Canada (be a Canadian citizen or permanent resident).
 The successful candidate must have an outgoing personality and be able to communicate politely and professionally both verbally and in writing.

To Apply for this position:

 Please submit your cover letter and resumé through our online application as a PDF attachment through the link on our careers page at https://worklink.bc.ca/careers/
 This posting will remain in effect until the closing date of 4:00 pm on Mar 31, 2024
 Applications/uploaded resumes sent via social media platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, Facebook) will not be accepted.

We appreciate all applications, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
WorkLink values the diversity of the people it hires and serves. We foster a workplace where individual differences are recognized and respected, while utilizing each person’s talents and strengths.
The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be!
Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal, Internship / Co-opContract length: 16 weeks
Salary: $20.20 per hour
Expected hours: 35 per week
Benefits:

 Casual dress
 Company events

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Ability to Commute:

 Victoria, BC V9B 3Y7 (required)

Ability to Relocate:

 Victoria, BC V9B 3Y7: Relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person
Expected start date: 2024-05-02

companyInfo/companyDescription: Introba is one of the world’s largest building engineering and consulting firms with more than 1,000 employees in offices across the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Serbia, and Australia. Committed to reshaping the world, our problem solvers combine cutting-edge digital solutions with emerging innovations and industry-leading sustainability strategies to transform the built environment. We collaborate with our clients to create living systems that are smart, secure, resilient, and connected – spaces that uplift communities, protect the health of the planet, and adapt to meet the demands of the future.
description:
WHERE PASSION + PURPOSE ALIGN
  
 
 
 
  
    We are the curious. Problem solvers. Driven to unlock the potential in every system. Across five countries are 1,100 engineers, designers, and consultants collaborating to elevate the human experience, create more resilient communities, and protect the health of the planet. We transform the built environment by creating dynamic solutions — living systems — that are smart, resilient, and connected.
  
  
  
    At Introba, this is why we show up every day. To use our curiosity for good. To inspire change. To empower changemakers
  
  
  
    Introba provides world-class building engineering design, analytic, and consulting services at all scales, specializing in net-zero first thinking. Through the cultivation of thought leadership, we deliver sustainable and forward-thinking solutions to the most complex design challenges facing the world’s leading clients and partners.
  
 
 
 
   Job Summary
 
  Introba is seeking a mechanical engineering intern to join our team in Victoria, BC for 8-12 Months. This opportunity will start in May of 2024
 
 
   Responsibilities & Qualifications
 
 
 
   DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
 
   Assist in setting up AutoCAD/Revit drawing files including digitizing and cleaning up working drawings
   Assist with HVAC, Fire Protection and Plumbing drafting as per mark-ups and instruction provided by Team Leader/design staff
   Ensure Introba design checklist (drawing standards section) is being followed
   Ensure Introba’s AutoCAD/Revit Standards are being followed
   Maintain AutoCAD/Revit files
   Follow direct instruction from design staff to co-ordinate mechanical requirements with other mechanical services
   Detailed check of work prior to returning finished product to Designer
 
 
 
   Qualifications:
 
 
   Familiar with AutoCAD
   Familiar with Revit is an asset
   Ability to think mechanically and/or mechanically inclined
   Strong verbal and written communication skills
   Ability to multi-task and be a team player
   Ability to understand and execute direct instruction in order to provide support to all levels of designers
   In progress of University degree with knowledge and a passion for mechanical building systems and sustainable design
 
 
 
   Additional Information
 
 
 
   Introba is committed to pay equity. As part of that commitment, we have provided the base compensation range of $20 - $30 annually for this position and local market. We recognize that each candidate brings a unique set of skills, experience, education and competencies to the table that will be reflected in our offer. Introba is proud to offer exciting career development opportunities.
 
 
 
   Introba offers a comprehensive total rewards package. Our benefits may include medical*, disability* and life insurance coverage*, continuing education benefits, paid time off, employee assistance program and a retirement savings plan with company matching contributions. *Benefits will vary by country location and may only be available in US or Canada.
 
 
 
   We encourage all candidates to explore our total rewards offering.
 
 
 
   Introba is an equal opportunity employer, and we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type as protected by federal, provincial, state or local laws. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The company and its employees are required to comply with all local health authority, legal or lawful client requirements.

description:
Town of View Royal 
 Engineering Intern
  
  1 Seasonal Full-Time Position $24.67/hr plus 10% in lieu of benefits 16-week term (negotiable): May 6 to August 30, 2024 Monday – Friday, 8:30AM - 4:30PM  The Town of View Royal is a growing residential community in the Greater Victoria area with a population of approximately 12,000. Our waterfront community has scenic views of Esquimalt Harbour and Portage Inlet, as well as excellent parks and trails, including the Galloping Goose Regional Trail and Thetis Lake Regional Park. Ten minutes from downtown Victoria, View Royal’s central location also provides good highway access to the Western Communities and to the Saanich Peninsula, including BC Ferries and the Victoria International Airport.  Reporting to the Director of Engineering, under the close supervision of the Deputy Director of Engineering, the Engineering Intern collects field data inventory using GPS, monitors and completes condition assessments for maintenance of Town infrastructure, assists with field or office projects and Engineering investigations, scans and files Engineering drawings and documents, and works with the Engineering Technologist to integrate GPS information into the existing GIS platform.  The ideal candidate for this position will be highly motivated with experience with ArcGIS; mapping grade GPS would also be beneficial.  In addition, the following qualifications are required: 
 
  Current enrollment in a Civil Engineering program at a recognized post-secondary institution; 
  Valid Class 5 BC Driver’s License.
 
  A detailed job description is available at www.viewroyal.ca.  Applicants should submit a detailed resume, including cover letter and references, which reflects their knowledge, skills and abilities relevant to the position, no later than 4:30pm, Monday, March 11, 2024 to:  Human Resources Competition #2024-02 Attn: Mr. Ivan Leung, Director of Engineering Town of View Royal 45 View Royal Avenue Victoria, BC V9B 1A6 Fax: 250-727-9551 Email: hr@viewroyal.ca  Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
 Education : College/CEGEP 
 Experience : Experience an asset
descriptionHTML:
Town of View Royal

Engineering Intern



1 Seasonal Full-Time Position
$24.67/hr plus 10% in lieu of benefits
16-week term (negotiable): May 6 to August 30, 2024 Monday – Friday, 8:30AM - 4:30PM

The Town of View Royal is a growing residential community in the Greater Victoria area with a population of approximately 12,000. Our waterfront community has scenic views of Esquimalt Harbour and Portage Inlet, as well as excellent parks and trails, including the Galloping Goose Regional Trail and Thetis Lake Regional Park. Ten minutes from downtown Victoria, View Royal’s central location also provides good highway access to the Western Communities and to the Saanich Peninsula, including BC Ferries and the Victoria International Airport.

Reporting to the Director of Engineering, under the close supervision of the Deputy Director of Engineering, the Engineering Intern collects field data inventory using GPS, monitors and completes condition assessments for maintenance of Town infrastructure, assists with field or office projects and Engineering investigations, scans and files Engineering drawings and documents, and works with the Engineering Technologist to integrate GPS information into the existing GIS platform.

The ideal candidate for this position will be highly motivated with experience with ArcGIS; mapping grade GPS would also be beneficial.

In addition, the following qualifications are required:

  • Current enrollment in a Civil Engineering program at a recognized post-secondary institution;
  • Valid Class 5 BC Driver’s License.


A detailed job description is available at www.viewroyal.ca.

Applicants should submit a detailed resume, including cover letter and references, which reflects their knowledge, skills and abilities relevant to the position, no later than 4:30pm, Monday, March 11, 2024 to:

Human Resources
Competition #2024-02
Attn: Mr. Ivan Leung, Director of Engineering
Town of View Royal
45 View Royal Avenue
Victoria, BC V9B 1A6
Fax: 250-727-9551
Email: hr@viewroyal.ca

Please note that only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.


Education : College/CEGEP
Experience : Experience an asset

companyInfo/companyDescription: BC Pension Corporation is one of the largest pension plan administrative agents in Canada.
description:
Financial Analyst Co-op
  Open to students registered in a recognized co-op program only
  (Within the Greater Victoria area)
  BC Pension Corporation, Victoria BC
 
   Duration: May 2024 to August 2024 (4 months with opportunity to be extended for an additional 4-month term upon mutual agreement)
   Location: Victoria (our office is situated on the Selkirk Waterfront on the Gorge Inlet. Enjoy stunning views of downtown Victoria and the Olympic mountains and take advantage of the nearby Galloping Goose Regional Trail for walking and biking).
   Salary: $1,819.12 bi-weekly (for students working towards a diploma or bachelor's degree) or $2,136.88 (for students working towards a post-graduate degree) 
  Grant: As part of our inVESTED scholarship program, you may be eligible for reimbursement up to a maximum of $1,000 per four-month work term to cover the cost of co-op work term tuition fees.
   Hybrid Work Model: Employees are supported to work part of their time from home and part of their time on campus to encourage flexibility, performance and connection.
   Skills for Success Program: Engage with other co-op students in a monthly virtual event designed to build connection and community while developing skills to support your success.
   LinkedIn Learning: During your time working here, you will have 24/7 unlimited access to over 16,000 online courses to help support your personal, educational, and professional goals.
   Team: The Corporate Planning and Analysis branch is responsible for preparing a variety of financial reports and statements for management. The team prepares budgets, variance analysis and financial forecasts at a detailed level; allocates the corporate costs to the plans and develops estimations and explanations of future allocations; and provides procurement advice and services.
 
  The Job Responsibilities
  This role will support the provision of financial analysis services in the preparation of corporate budgets, forecasts, and financial reporting. You will also assist in the documentation of financial procedures, processes, and account structure.
  The successful candidate may:
 
   Participate in the development and maintenance of documentation for procedures and related support e.g., training materials, knowledge base, etc. 
  Assist in the preparation of financial management reports and spreadsheets to track and monitor corporation expenditures, ensure accuracy and completeness of information.
   Assist in the preparation of the financial statements and supporting benchmarking exercises and cost allocation. 
  Recommend and implement procedures to improve efficiency and enhance controls.
   Help assist with ad-hoc financial reports and projects.
 
  Learning Outcomes
  The successful candidate can expect to gain experience in the following areas:
 
   Experience in developing reports in financial management systems and processes to analyze unstructured information collected through a variety of platforms
   Experience in assessing value and accuracy of information, defining relationships, differences and anomalies in information sources
   Experience in problem definition and analysis
   Learn how to build and maintain working relationships and increase your communication skills
   Experience in planning, organization, and prioritization skills
   Exposure to collaboration and project tool sets like MS Teams, Share point, Confluence & Jira
   Exposure to SQL/Oracle Databases
 
  Requirements
  This opportunity is available to students who have completed their second year of a Bachelor of Business Administration degree (Accounting Major preferred) or Bachelor of Commerce.
  As a prospective team member of BC Pension Corporation, the successful co-op student will have:
 
   Ability to perform basic to intermediate Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, etc.) and e-mail.
   An aptitude for and ability to perform calculations and documentation.
   Ability to apply accuracy, consistency, and attention to detail.
   Ability to maintain courtesy, professionalism and confidentiality.
   An eagerness to learn and solve and manage problems
 
  As part of your application, please upload the following documents (note: your application may not be viewed if you do not include all 3 required documents as per below):
 
   Cover letter
   Resume
   Transcripts (unofficial transcripts are accepted)
 
  Click here to apply now
  Diversity & Inclusion
  BC Pension Corporation is an equal opportunity employer committed to establishing an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment for all. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status or any other basis protected by applicable law.
  We are committed to ensuring that reasonable accommodation is made available to persons with disabilities during the recruitment, assessment and selection processes and will provide reasonable accommodation upon request. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please email us at co-op@pensionsbc.ca. 
 Thank you for your interest in working with us. We will let you know about your status in this competition as soon as possible. If you have questions about this opportunity, please email us at co-op@pensionsbc.ca.
descriptionHTML:
Financial Analyst Co-op

Open to students registered in a recognized co-op program only

(Within the Greater Victoria area)


BC Pension Corporation, Victoria BC

  • Duration: May 2024 to August 2024 (4 months with opportunity to be extended for an additional 4-month term upon mutual agreement)
  • Location: Victoria (our office is situated on the Selkirk Waterfront on the Gorge Inlet. Enjoy stunning views of downtown Victoria and the Olympic mountains and take advantage of the nearby Galloping Goose Regional Trail for walking and biking).
  • Salary: $1,819.12 bi-weekly (for students working towards a diploma or bachelor's degree) or $2,136.88 (for students working towards a post-graduate degree)
  • Grant: As part of our inVESTED scholarship program, you may be eligible for reimbursement up to a maximum of $1,000 per four-month work term to cover the cost of co-op work term tuition fees.
  • Hybrid Work Model: Employees are supported to work part of their time from home and part of their time on campus to encourage flexibility, performance and connection.
  • Skills for Success Program: Engage with other co-op students in a monthly virtual event designed to build connection and community while developing skills to support your success.
  • LinkedIn Learning: During your time working here, you will have 24/7 unlimited access to over 16,000 online courses to help support your personal, educational, and professional goals.
  • Team: The Corporate Planning and Analysis branch is responsible for preparing a variety of financial reports and statements for management. The team prepares budgets, variance analysis and financial forecasts at a detailed level; allocates the corporate costs to the plans and develops estimations and explanations of future allocations; and provides procurement advice and services.

The Job Responsibilities

This role will support the provision of financial analysis services in the preparation of corporate budgets, forecasts, and financial reporting. You will also assist in the documentation of financial procedures, processes, and account structure.

The successful candidate may:

  • Participate in the development and maintenance of documentation for procedures and related support e.g., training materials, knowledge base, etc.
  • Assist in the preparation of financial management reports and spreadsheets to track and monitor corporation expenditures, ensure accuracy and completeness of information.
  • Assist in the preparation of the financial statements and supporting benchmarking exercises and cost allocation.
  • Recommend and implement procedures to improve efficiency and enhance controls.
  • Help assist with ad-hoc financial reports and projects.

Learning Outcomes

The successful candidate can expect to gain experience in the following areas:

  • Experience in developing reports in financial management systems and processes to analyze unstructured information collected through a variety of platforms
  • Experience in assessing value and accuracy of information, defining relationships, differences and anomalies in information sources
  • Experience in problem definition and analysis
  • Learn how to build and maintain working relationships and increase your communication skills
  • Experience in planning, organization, and prioritization skills
  • Exposure to collaboration and project tool sets like MS Teams, Share point, Confluence & Jira
  • Exposure to SQL/Oracle Databases

Requirements

This opportunity is available to students who have completed their second year of a Bachelor of Business Administration degree (Accounting Major preferred) or Bachelor of Commerce.

As a prospective team member of BC Pension Corporation, the successful co-op student will have:

  • Ability to perform basic to intermediate Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, etc.) and e-mail.
  • An aptitude for and ability to perform calculations and documentation.
  • Ability to apply accuracy, consistency, and attention to detail.
  • Ability to maintain courtesy, professionalism and confidentiality.
  • An eagerness to learn and solve and manage problems

As part of your application, please upload the following documents (note: your application may not be viewed if you do not include all 3 required documents as per below):

  • Cover letter
  • Resume
  • Transcripts (unofficial transcripts are accepted)

Click here to apply now

Diversity & Inclusion

BC Pension Corporation is an equal opportunity employer committed to establishing an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment for all. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status or any other basis protected by applicable law.

We are committed to ensuring that reasonable accommodation is made available to persons with disabilities during the recruitment, assessment and selection processes and will provide reasonable accommodation upon request. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please email us at co-op@pensionsbc.ca.

Thank you for your interest in working with us. We will let you know about your status in this competition as soon as possible. If you have questions about this opportunity, please email us at co-op@pensionsbc.ca.

company: Coastal Research, Education, and Advocacy Network (CREAN)
companyInfo/companyDescription: Coastal Research, Education, and Advocacy Network empowers vulnerable youth through research, education, and advocacy. Our community-based research informs our services, with the intention of deepening connections and improving the lives of youth, families, and their communities. We work closely with residents and community leaders to advocate, both locally and nationally, on behalf of youth to make our city a better place to live.
description:
Location: 722 Cormorant St, Victoria, BC (must live in BC)
Dockhands provide a five-hour weekly commitment over a three or six month period. In exchange, you will be gaining 24/7 access to a dynamic downtown coworking space and a community of cutting edge social impact professionals! Further you will be able to access 30+ local business discounts, build your resume, take advantage of mentorship offerings, achieve a professional certification, and enjoy exclusive opportunities.
Dockhands are compensated for their valuable time by receiving a free membership and 24/7 coworking package, including 4 credits toward meeting space included per month, in addition to the other benefits mentioned!
This Dockhand team is composed of career professionals, post-secondary students and recent graduates, entrepreneurs, community members, retirees, and more! If you are interested then there is a place for you in the Dockhand team.
